problems.title: Blowing Fine Dust
problems.description: White dust (drywall/concrete) shoots out the exhaust.
possible_causes: Using standard filter for fine dust
solution_steps: Standard filters (VF4000) cannot handle drywall dust.
Upgrade to a Fine Dust Filter (VF5000) or HEPA (VF6000).

problems.title: Hose Clogged / Crushed
problems.description: Hose is kinked or suction is low.
solution_steps: Ridgid hoses are tough but can crush. Pop it back out or replace.
Use a stick to clear clogs.

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the issue on a 12 Gallon Wet/Dry Vac (NXT)?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement part typically costs significantly less than a new $354 vacuum, and extending the life of your Ridgid is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my 12 Gallon Wet/Dry Vac (NXT) needs a new part?
faqs.answer: Common signs include strange noises and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the part on my 12 Gallon Wet/Dry Vac (NXT) myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
